intro: Alansmia bradeana, commonly known as the Brade's larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are arranged in racemes. Alansmia bradeana is a perennial herb that is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
